columns.text: In this exercise, we are going to learn about equity as an option using Black Scholes Model and net present value.

To start with, let us define  Black Scholes Model. 

**Black Scholes Model** is a mathematical equation that involves probabilities to compute the price of an option. 

The equation of the Black Scholes Model is illustrated as follows: 

$$\textbf{C}=\text{S}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d1})}-\text{X}\times\text{e}^{\text{-rt}}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d2)}}$$

Where: 

- C- Call Option
- S- Stock Price
- X - Exercise Price
- r - rate
- t - time
- N(d1) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d1
- N(d2) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d2

The **net present value (NPV)** is the present value of initial investment or cash outflow less the present value of the cash inflows.

In investment decisions, the firm should choose the alternative with a higher net present value.

Whereas d1 is solved as follows: 

$$\textbf{d}_{1}=\frac{\left[\text{ln}\frac{\text{S}}{\text{X}}\right]+\left(\text{r}+\frac{σ^2}{2}\right)\times\text{t}}{\left(σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}\right)}$$

And d2's equation is illustrated below: 

$$\textbf{d}_{2}=\text{d}_{1}-σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}$$

Where: 

- σ - Standard deviation
- ln - natural logarithm

Here are the parameters to solve the problem : 


|Given | | 
|--|--| 
| Market value (MV) of firm's assets  |$16,200 | 
|Face value (FV) of debt |$15,000| 
|Risk-free rate (r) | 6% | 
|Time (t) |1 year | 
|Standard deviation(σ) | 34% per year| 
| e| 2.71828|

The details of the two projects are solved as follows: 



| |Net Present Value | Standard Deviation| 
|--|--|--| 
|Project A |$1,900 |46% | 
|Project B |$2,800 |29% |

## Requirement A

We are asked to solve the value of equity and debt if Project A or B is undertaken. 

First, we have to solve the value of the asset using this equation. 

$$\textbf{Asset}=\text{MV of Firm's Assets}+\text{NPV of Project}$$

The market value of the firm's asset is added by the net present value of the project to determine the value of the asset of the particular project.

### Value of Equity and Debt of Project A

Using the equation in Step 7, the value of the asset of Project A is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Asset of Project A}&=\$16,200+\$1,900\\[15pt]
&=\$18,100
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of assets of Project A is $18,100.

Next, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the value of assets and the face value of debt. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 


!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/1bfe1cad-5763-4be8-aa0f-bfc231f904e4-1661769427387249.png)



Therefore ln(S/X) is 0.1879.

Now, let us solve d1 using the equation in Step 3: 


 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0.1879+\left[0.06+\frac{0.46^2}{2}\right]\times1}{0.46\sqrt{1}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1879+\left[0.06+\frac{0.2116}{2}\right]\times1}{0.46\times1}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1879+\left[0.06+0.1058\right]\times1}{0.46}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1879+\left[0.1658\times1\right]}{0.46}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1879+0.1658}{0.46}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.3537}{0.46}\\[20pt]
&=0.7689
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 0.7689.

Now, we solve the value of d2 using the equation in Step 4: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{2}&=0.7689-0.46\times\sqrt{1}\\[15pt]
&=0.7689-0.46\times1\\[15pt]
&=0.7689-0.46\\[15pt]
&=0.3089
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of d2 is 0.3089.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.7794 | 
|Nd2 |0.6217 |

Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=\$18,100\times0.7794-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)(1)}\times0.6217\\[15pt]
&=\$18,100\times0.7794-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)}\times0.6217\\[15pt]
&=\$18,100\times0.7794-\$15,000\times0.9418\times0.6217\\[15pt]
&=\$18,100\times0.7794-\$15,000\times0.5855\\[15pt]
&=\$14,107-\$8,783\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\$5,324}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the call option or the firm's equity is $5,324.

### Value of Equity and Debt of Project B

Using the equation in Step 7, the value of the asset of Project B is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Asset of Project B}&=\$16,200+\$2,800\\[15pt]
&=\$19,000
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of the assets of Project B is $19,000.

Next, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the value of assets and the face value of debt. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/7b905ba6-2c4b-4abf-aa49-f6e3c76d5e7c-1661771315266216.png)




Therefore ln(S/X) is 0.2364.

Now, let us solve d1 using the equation in Step 3: 


 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0.2364+\left[0.06+\frac{0.29^2}{2}\right]\times1}{0.29\sqrt{1}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.2364+\left[0.06+\frac{0.0841}{2}\right]\times1}{0.29\times1}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.2364+\left[0.06+0.04205\right]\times1}{0.29}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.2364+\left[0.10205\times1\right]}{0.29}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.2364+0.10205}{0.29}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.33845}{0.29}\\[20pt]
&=1.17
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 1.17.

Now, we solve the value of d2 using the equation in Step 4: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{2}&=1.17-0.29\times\sqrt{1}\\[15pt]
&=1.17-0.29\times1\\[15pt]
&=1.17-0.29\\[15pt]
&=0.88
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of d2 is 0.88.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.879 | 
|Nd2 |0.8106 |

Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=\$19,000\times0.879-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)(1)}\times0.8106\\[15pt]
&=\$19,000\times0.879-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)}\times0.8106\\[15pt]
&=\$19,000\times0.879-\$15,000\times0.9418\times0.8106\\[15pt]
&=\$19,000\times0.879-\$15,000\times0.7634\\[15pt]
&=\$16,701-\$11,451\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\$5,250}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the call option or the firm's equity is $5,250.

## Requirement B

We are asked to identify which project stockholders will prefer using the net present value concept.

The value of equity of projects A and B are $5,324, and $5,250 respectively. From these figures, Project A has higher equity. On the other hand, the net present value of Projects A and B are $1,900, and $2,800 respectively. 

Although the net present value measures the profitability of a proposed investment, the stockholders will still prefer the project which has higher equity because the main goal of stockholders is to maximize the value of the corporation's equity. 

Therefore, stockholders will prefer Project A rather than Project B.

## Requirement C

We are asked to determine the stockholders' decision if stockholders and bondholders are in the same group.

If the stockholders and bondholders are within the same group, the project which has a higher net present value should be chosen. This is because a higher net present value increases the overall value of the equity as well.

## Requirement D 

We are asked to determine the relevance of stockholder incentives to this problem.

The value of equity and net present value are financial calculations that are used to examine proposed investments. 

 The stockholder's main goal is to maximize the value of the equity, therefore, although a project has higher risk, they will still prefer projects which generate a higher value of equity.
